evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: the court assumed respondents are: (1) arguing the district court lacks the inherent authority to grant bail; and (2) raising the same jurisdiction arguments here as raised in Bautista. In Bautista, the petitioners sought, and were granted, a TRO requiring the government to release them from custody or to provide them with an individualized bond hearing before an immigration judge within seven days of the issuance of a TRO.
